message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.HC, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) - The paper deals with decoding lip-motions, which is a visual signal, and involves analyzing and understanding the visual speech channel. This makes it highly likely to belong to the cs.CV sub-category.
2. cs.CL (Computation and Language) - The paper discusses the decoding of visemes into spoken sounds, which involves natural language processing. This makes it a possible fit for the cs.CL sub-category.
3. cs.SD (Sound) - Although the paper primarily deals with the visual speech signal, it also involves understanding spoken sounds. This makes it a possible fit for the cs.SD sub-category.
4. cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) - The paper has applications beyond machine lipreading, including speech therapy and psychology. This makes it a possible fit for the cs.HC sub-category.
5. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper involves analyzing and understanding visual and audio signals, which makes it a possible fit for the cs.MM sub-category.
